description: Find the right phone number, email or postal address to contact DVLA about driving licences, vehicle tax, medical enquiries and vehicle registration

details.body:
Use this service to find the right phone number, email or postal address for DVLA. They can help with things like:

  • vehicle tax or a Statutory Off Road Notification (SORN)
  • driving licences and applications
  • number plates and log books (V5C documents)
  • health conditions and driving

Find contact details for DVLA

options.label: Vehicle registration and V5C certificates (log books)
Viewing or sharing your driving licence information

nodes.title: What do you need to contact DVLA about?

options.label: Translation if you do not speak English or Welsh

nodes.title: What do you need help with?
Is it about a driver or a vehicle?

nodes.body:
Before you contact DVLA, read how to:

  • get a vehicle log book (V5C)
  • get vehicle information from DVLA
  • tell DVLA you’ve sold or bought a vehicle
  • change your name and address on your V5C
  • register a vehicle
  • get a private (personalised) number plate
  • put a registration number on a vehicle
  • take a registration number off a vehicle
  • change vehicle details on a V5C
  • take a vehicle out of the UK
  • import a vehicle into the UK

When to contact DVLA

Wait for the processing time before contacting DVLA.

If you have not received your log book after 6 weeks and you have not notified DVLA, you’ll have to pay £25 to get a replacement.

If you applied online

Type of application Processing time
Get a duplicate log book 2 weeks
Change of address 4 weeks
Change of registered keeper 4 weeks
Confirmation you’ve sold your vehicle 4 weeks
Put on, take off or keep a private registration number 2 weeks

If you applied by phone or post

Contact DVLA if you have not received your log book and it’s been 4 weeks since you applied.

By phone

DVLA Vehicle Enquiries
Telephone: 0300 790 6802
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on a mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm
Saturdays, 8am to 2pm
Find out about call charges

By webchat

Use the webchat service to contact DVLA about vehicle registration and V5C certificates (log books).

By email

Use the email service to contact DVLA about vehicle registration.

By post

Vehicle Customer Services
DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1AR
nodes.title: Vehicle registration and V5C certificates (log books)

nodes.body:
Before you contact DVLA, read how to:

  • tax your vehicle
  • make a Statutory Off Road Notification (SORN)
  • check if a vehicle is taxed
  • cancel vehicle tax and get a refund
  • pay your vehicle tax by Direct Debit
  • tax your vehicle without a V11 reminder
  • change your vehicle’s tax class

When to contact DVLA

Wait for the processing time before contacting DVLA.

Type of application Processing time
SORN confirmation by telephone 4 weeks
Vehicle tax refund by telephone or online 6 weeks
All DVLA applications by post 6 to 8 weeks

By phone

DVLA Vehicle Enquiries
Telephone: 0300 790 6802
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on a mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm
Saturdays, 8am to 2pm
Find out about call charges

By webchat

Use the webchat service to contact DVLA about vehicle tax and SORN.

By email

Use the email service to contact DVLA about vehicle tax and SORN.

By post

Vehicle Customer Services
DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1AR
nodes.title: Vehicle tax and SORN

nodes.body:
Before you contact DVLA, read how to:

  • change your address on your driving licence
  • view or share your driving licence information
  • replace a lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed driving licence
  • track your driving licence application
  • apply for your first provisional driving licence
  • order forms online from DVLA
  • change your name on your driving licence

When to contact DVLA

How long it takes to get your driving licence depends on how you sent your application.

Type of application Processing time
Online 2 weeks
Post 3 weeks

Wait for the processing time before you contact DVLA.

It might take longer if DVLA needs to check your identity or medical details.

By phone

DVLA Driving Licence Enquiries
Telephone: 0300 790 6801
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on a mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm
Saturdays, 8am to 2pm
Find out about call charges

By webchat

Use the webchat service to contact DVLA about driving licences and applications.

By email

Use the email service to contact DVLA about driving licences and applications.

By post

Drivers Customer Services
Correspondence Team
DVLA
Swansea
SA6 7JL

Northern Ireland

Contact the Driver and Vehicle Agency if you have a Northern Ireland driving licence.
nodes.title: Driving licences and applications

nodes.body:
Before you contact DVLA, read about:

  • which medical conditions you must tell DVLA about
  • what happens after you’ve told DVLA about your medical condition
  • how to disagree with DVLA’s decision about your medical condition
  • how to reapply for a driving licence following a medical condition
  • how to surrender your driving licence because of a medical condition

If you tell DVLA about a medical condition, your application will usually take 6 weeks. It may take longer if it needs to be referred to a doctor.

By phone

DVLA Medical Enquiries
Telephone: 0300 790 6806
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on a mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm
Saturdays, 8am to 2pm
Find out about call charges

By email

You can email DVLA to tell them about your driving and medical issues.

By post

Drivers' Medical Enquiries
DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1TU

Northern Ireland

Contact the Driver and Vehicle Agency if you have a Northern Ireland driving licence.
nodes.title: Driving and medical issues

nodes.body:
You can check someone’s driving licence information online, by phone or by post if you’re an employer or hire car company. The driver must give their permission for the check.

Northern Ireland

Contact the Driver and Vehicle Agency if the driver has a Northern Ireland driving licence.
nodes.title: Checking someone else's licence

nodes.body:
Contact the department in DVLA you’ve been dealing with if you have a complaint. The contact details will be on any letters or emails you’ve been sent.

If you’re still unhappy, find out how to complain about DVLA.

Driving licence complaints if you’re in Northern Ireland

Complain to the Driver and Vehicle Agency (DVA) instead if you’re both:

  • in Northern Ireland
  • complaining about a driving licence
nodes.title: Complaints

nodes.body:

nodes.title: Ymholiadau Cymraeg

nodes.body:
Contact DVLA’s translation service if you do not speak English or speak Welsh.

Vehicle registration and tax

Telephone: 0906 737 0013
Monday to Friday, 10am to 4pm
Saturday, closed
Find out about call charges

Driving licence and medical issues

Telephone: 0906 737 0012
Monday to Friday, 10am to 4pm
Saturday, closed
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Translation if you do not speak English or Welsh

nodes.body:
DVLA does not deal with driving tests and theory tests.

You need to contact the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) instead.
nodes.title: Driving tests and theory tests

nodes.body:
DVLA does not deal with MOTs.

You need to contact the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) instead.
nodes.title: MOTs

nodes.body:
You can view your own driving record online, by phone or by post.

Northern Ireland

Contact the Driver and Vehicle Agency if you have a Northern Ireland driving licence.
nodes.title: Viewing or sharing your driving licence information

nodes.body:
Before you contact DVLA, read about:

  • who is eligible for trade licence plates
  • how to apply for a trade licence and how much they cost
  • the rules for using your trade plates
  • how to replace lost, stolen or damaged trade plates
  • how to renew your trade licence
  • how to change your business name or address
  • how to end your trade licence and return your trade plates

When to contact DVLA

You should receive your trade plates within 4 weeks of DVLA receiving your application. Contact DVLA if it’s been more than 4 weeks since you applied.

By phone

DVLA Trade Licence Plate Enquiries
Telephone: 0300 300 1495
Monday to Friday, 8am to 7pm
Saturdays, 8am to 2pm
Find out about call charges

By post

DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1DZ
